contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Infobox Olympics Zimbabwe |games=2000 Summer |competitors=16 (11 men and 5 women) |sports=5 |flagbearer=[[Phillip Mukomana]] |officials= }} '''[[Zimbabwe]]''' competed at the '''[[2000 Summer Olympics]]''' in [[Sydney]], [[Australia]]. ==Results by event== ===[[Athletics at the 2000 Summer Olympics|Athletics]]=== '''Men's 400m''' * [[Tawanda Chiwira]] :* Round 1 — 46.5 (→ did not advance) * [[Philiph Mukomana]] :* Round 1 — 47.11 (→ did not advance) '''Men's 800m''' * [[Crispen Mutakanyi]] :* Round 1 — 01:47.7 (→ did not advance) '''Men's 400m Hurdles''' * [[Kenneth Harnden]] :* Round 1 — 51.83 (→ did not advance) * [[Iain Harnden]] :* Round 1 — 54.01 (→ did not advance) '''Men's 4x400m''' * [[Tawanda Bless Chiwira]], [[Kenneth Harnden]], [[Philiph Mukomana]], [[Crispen Mutakanyi]] :* Round 1 — 03:05.60 (→ did not advance) '''Men's Marathon''' * [[Tendai Chimusasa]] :* Final — 0:02:14 (→ 9th place) '''Women's 1,500m''' * [[Julia Sakara]] :* Round 1 — 04:21.94 (→ did not advance) '''Women's 5,000m''' * [[Samukeliso Moyo]] :* Round 1 — 15:47.76 (→ did not advance) ===[[Diving at the 2000 Summer Olympics|Diving]]=== '''Men's 3 Metre Springboard''' * [[Evan Stewart]] :* Preliminary — 313.53 (→ did not advance, 38th place) ===[[Swimming at the 2000 Summer Olympics|Swimming]]=== '''Men's 100m Freestyle''' * [[Glen Walshaw]] :* Preliminary Heat — 52.53 (→ did not advance) '''Men's 200m Freestyle''' * [[Glen Walshaw]] :* Preliminary Heat — 1:54.70 (→ did not advance) '''Women's 50m Freestyle''' * [[Kirsty Coventry]] :* Preliminary Heat — 26.58 (→ did not advance) '''Women's 100m Freestyle''' * [[Kirsty Coventry]] :* Preliminary Heat — 57.47 (→ did not advance) '''Women's 200m Freestyle''' * [[Mandy Leach]] :* Preliminary Heat — 02:01.05 :* Semi-final — 02:00.60 (→ did not advance) '''Women's 100m Backstroke''' * [[Kirsty Coventry]] :* Preliminary Heat — 01:03.05 :* Semi-final — 01:02.54 (→ did not advance) '''Women's 200m Individual Medley''' * [[Kirsty Coventry]] :* Preliminary Heat — 02:17.73 (→ did not advance) ===[[Tennis at the 2000 Summer Olympics|Tennis]]=== '''Men's Singles Competition''' * [[Kevin Ullyett]] :* First Round — Defeated [[Albert Costa]] (Spa) 3-6, 6-3 and 11-9 :* Second Round — Lost to [[Ivan Ljubičić]] (Cro) 2-6, 6-4 and 4-6 * [[Wayne Black]] :* First Round — Lost to [[Jiří Vaněk (tennis player)|Jiří Vaněk]] (Cze) 7-5, 1-6 and 1-6 '''Men's Doubles Competition''' * [[Kevin Ullyett]] and [[Wayne Black]] :* First Round — Lost to [[Tommy Haas]] and [[David Prinosil]] (Ger) 1-6 and 4-6 '''Women's Singles Competition''' * [[Cara Black]] :* First Round — Lost to [[Silvia Farina]] (Ita) 2-6, 6-3 and 3-6 ===[[Triathlon at the 2000 Summer Olympics|Triathlon]]=== '''Men's Individual Competition:''' * [[Mark Marabini]] — DNF (→ no ranking) ==References== {{refbegin}} *Wallechinsky, David (2004). ''The Complete Book of the Summer Olympics (Athens 2004 Edition)''. Toronto, Canada. ISBN 1-894963-32-6. *International Olympic Committee (2001). [http://www.gamesinfo.com.au/results/results.pdf The Results]. Retrieved 12 November 2005. *Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games (2001). [http://www.la84foundation.org/6oic/OfficialReports/2000/2000v1.pdf Official Report of the XXVII Olympiad Volume 1: Preparing for the Games]. Retrieved 20 November 2005. *Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games (2001). [http://www.la84foundation.org/6oic/OfficialReports/2000/2000v2.pdf Official Report of the XXVII Olympiad Volume 2: Celebrating the Games]. Retrieved 20 November 2005. *Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games (2001). [http://www.la84foundation.org/6oic/OfficialReports/2000/Results.pdf The Results]. Retrieved 20 November 2005. *[http://www.olympic.org International Olympic Committee Web Site] *[http://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/countries/ZIM/summer/2000/ sports-reference] {{refend}} {{NOCin2000SummerOlympics}} [[Category:Nations at the 2000 Summer Olympics]] [[Category:Zimbabwe at the Olympics|2000]] [[Category:2000 in Zimbabwean sport|Summer Olympics]]
